Option.Name: Straight Sword / Greatsword / Ultra Greatsword / Whip
One hand down and behind hip

behaviorVariationId.Wiki: Behavior Variation ID determines base offset for BehaviorParam_PCs to use while holding this weapon

sortId.Wiki: This controls the position of the weapon in your menu.\nNote that reinforcement will add the current level of reinforcement to this ID,\nso infusion entries should be spaced appropriately.

wanderingEquipId.Wiki: Weapon ID used by wandering ghosts online.

weight.Wiki: The weight value shown in the game menu, affects equip load

weaponWeightRate.Wiki: Used in determining action cancel timing in TAE.\n0 is soonest, 1 is latest.

fixPrice.Wiki: This is the amount of souls it will take to fix this item.

basicPrice.Wiki: The base soul cost it will take to reinforce this item.\nScales with each consecutive upgrade.

sellValue.Wiki: The souls given when this item is sold.

correctStrength.Wiki: The base scaling value used for Strength.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

correctAgility.Wiki: The base scaling value used for Dexterity.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

corretMagic.Wiki: The base scaling value used for Intelligence.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

corretFaith.Wiki: The base scaling value used for Faith.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

physGuardCutRate.Wiki: The Physical absorption to use when guarding.

magGuardCutRate.Wiki: The Magic absorption to use when guarding.

fireGuardCutRate.Wiki: The Fire absorption to use when guarding.

thunGuardCutRate.Wiki: The Lightning absorption to use when guarding.

spEffectBehaviorId0.Wiki: The SpEffect to apply to the enemy on hit.

spEffectBehaviorId1.Wiki: The SpEffect to apply to the enemy on hit.

spEffectBehaviorId2.Wiki: The SpEffect to apply to the enemy on hit.

residentSpEffectId0.Wiki: The SpEffect to apply passively to the player while holding the item in an active hand.

residentSpEffectId1.Wiki: The SpEffect to apply passively to the player while holding the item in an active hand.

residentSpEffectId2.Wiki: The SpEffect to apply passively to the player while holding the item in an active hand.

materialSetId.Wiki: Determines the EquipMtrlSetParam row range used for reinforcement.

originEquipWep0.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep1.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep2.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep3.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep4.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep5.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep6.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep7.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep8.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep9.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep10.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep11.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep12.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep13.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep14.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

originEquipWep15.Wiki: Contains the base weapon ID.\nDetermines the max reinforcement level and what an infused weapon returns to when uninfused.

antUndeadDamageRate.Wiki: Modifies damage against Undead-type enemies.\nValues above 1 also prevent skeleton reanimation.

equipModelId.Wiki: The part model ID. Determines the part model used by the weapon.

iconId.Wiki: The icon index ID. Determines the icon used by the weapon.

durability.Wiki: Determines how quickly durability is drained by attacking.\nLower is faster.

durailityMax.Wiki: This the maximum durability, it will be shown in the game GUI

atkBasePhysics.Wiki: The base Physical damage.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

atkBaseMagic.Wiki: The base Magic damage.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

atkBaseFire.Wiki: The base Fire damage.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

atkBaseThunder.Wiki: The base Lightning damage.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

atkBaseStamina.Wiki: The base Stamina damage that is applied to an enemy when guarding.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

saWeaponDamage.Wiki: The base Poise damage.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

staminaGuardDef.Wiki: This is the Stability value in the game menu.\nDetermines stamina consumed when blocking with this item, higher stability means less stamina consumed.

reinforceTypeId.Wiki: ID of ReinforceParamWeapon to use for calculating the effects of reinforcement.

throwAtkRate.Wiki: The critical multiplier applied when Riposting or Backstabbing an enemy.

bowDistRate.Wiki: The bow distance added to ammunition range.\nValue given is percent difference from 50.\nExample: Value -30 gives 35 range ingame (50 + (50 * -0.3)) = 50 - 15 = 35

wepmotionCategory.Wiki: Determines the base moveset used by the weapon. Corresponds to TAE ID.

guardmotionCategory.Wiki: Determines the moveset used whilst guarding.

correctType.Wiki: Determines the stat graph used for Physical damage (i.e. how effective a stat is).\nAlso affects STR/DEX portion of Spell Buff if applicable (Does not appear).

spAtkCategory.Wiki: Determines the override moveset used by the weapon. Corresponds to TAE ID.

properStrength.Wiki: Determines the level of Strength required to wield this weapon.

properAgility.Wiki: Determines the level of Dexterity required to wield this weapon

properMagic.Wiki: Determines the level of Intelligence required to wield this weapon.

properFaith.Wiki: Determines the level of Faith required to wield this weapon.

attackBaseParry.Wiki: If this is greater than defender's Parry Defense, the attack cannot be parried.

defenseBaseParry.Wiki: If this is equal to or greater than attacker's Parry Attack, the attack can be parried.

guardBaseRepel.Wiki: If this is greater than attacker's Flick Attack, the attack is deflected and damage is reduced by 50%.

attackBaseRepel.Wiki: If this is greater than defender's Passive/Guard Flick, the attack is not deflected.\nAtkParam can modify this value.

guardCutCancelRate.Wiki: Percentage of target's current guard rate to bypass.\nGuard bypass starts at 255 for 1 percent bypass to 156 for 100 percent bypass.\n(Needs testing) Values of 1 to 100 will increase guarding effectiveness.

poisonGuardResist.Wiki: The Poison resistance this item will have while guarding

toxicGuardResist.Wiki: The Toxic resistance this item will have while guarding

bloodGuardResist.Wiki: The Bleed resistance this item will have while guarding

curseGuardResist.Wiki: The Curse resistance this item will have while guarding. This will not affect the Basilisk's curse mist.

rightHandEquipable.Wiki: Determines whether this item can be equipped in right hand slots.

leftHandEquipable.Wiki: Determines whether this item can be equipped in left hand slots.

bothHandEquipable.Wiki: This value determines whether this item can be 2 handed.

arrowSlotEquipable.Wiki: Determines whether this item can be equipped in the arrow slots.

boltSlotEquipable.Wiki: Determines whether this item can be equipped in the bolt slots.

enableGuard.Wiki: Determines whether this weapon can be affected by shield buffs such as Magic Shield.

enableParry.Wiki: Determines whether this weapon can parry (requires TAE support for actual effect).

enableMagic.Wiki: Determines whether this weapon can cast Sorceries\nRequires HKS or TAE support for actual effect.

enablePyromancy.Wiki: Determines whether this weapon can cast Pyromancies\nRequires HKS or TAE support for actual effect.

enableMiracle.Wiki: Determines whether this weapon can cast Miracles\nRequires HKS or TAE support for actual effect.

enableVowMagic.Wiki: Determines whether this weapon can cast Vow Magic (Magic 4).\nRequires HKS or TAE support for actual effect.

isNormalAttackType.Wiki: Display Standard as the damage type in the weapon menu.\nActual type is defined in BehaviorParam_PC.

isBlowAttackType.Wiki: Display Strike as the damage type in the weapon menu.\nActual type is defined in BehaviorParam_PC.

isSlashAttackType.Wiki: Display Slash as the damage type in the weapon menu.\nActual type is defined in BehaviorParam_PC.

isThrustAttackType.Wiki: Display Thrust as the damage type in the weapon menu.\nActual type is defined in BehaviorParam_PC.

isEnhance.Wiki: Determines whether this weapon can be buffed via SpEffects.

isLuckCorrect.Wiki: Scales all damage with Humanity up to 10.

isCustom.Wiki: Determines whether this weapon can be reinforced.

isDarkHand.Wiki: Allows Dark Hand shield VFX to display when Jumptable 85 is active.

isVersusGhostWep.Wiki: Can damage/stagger enemies set as Ghosts (NPCParam).

baseChangeCategory.Wiki:
Infusion A/B/C/D determines infusion ico.
FFFF Normal
TFFF Heavy
FTFF Sharp
TTFF Refined
FFTF Crystal
TFTF Simple
FTTF Fire
TTTF Chaos
FFFT Lightning
TFFT Deep
FTFT Dark
TTFT Poison
FFTT Blood
TFTT Raw
FTTT Blessed
TTTT Hollow

Infusion A/B/C/D determines infusion icon.
FFFF Normal
TFFF Heavy
FTFF Sharp
TTFF Refined
FFTF Crystal
TFTF Simple
FTTF Fire
TTTF Chaos
FFFT Lightning
TFFT Deep
FTFT Dark
TTFT Poison
FFTT Blood
TFTT Raw

isDeposit.Wiki:
Infusion A/B/C/D determines infusion icon.
FFFF Normal
TFFF Heavy
FTFF Sharp
TTFF Refined
FFTF Crystal
TFTF Simple
FTTF Fire
TTTF Chaos
FFFT Lightning
TFFT Deep
FTFT Dark
TTFT Poison

disableMultiDropShare.Wiki:
Infusion A/B/C/D determines infusion icon.
FFFF Normal
TFFF Heavy
FTFF Sharp
TTFF Refined
FFTF Crystal
TFTF Simple
FTTF Fire
TTTF Chaos
FFFT Lightning
TFFT Deep
FTFT Dark
TTFT Poison
FFTT Blood
TFTT Raw
FTTT Blessed
TTTT Hollow

Bool1.Wiki: If E is true and A/B/C/D are false, this is an extra infusion with its own icon and event flag.

Bool2.Wiki: Technically infusion related but has no associated icons or event flags, so it's basically non-functional.

DisableShoot.Wiki: Flags weapon/ammo to use alt set (i.e. greatbows and greatarrows).

wepAbsorpPosId.Wiki: This determines what Sheath Position ID to use.\nThis affects where the weapon is positioned in various hand states.

Unk12.Wiki: Determines the multiplier to apply to Toughness (when applied via InvokeToughness in TAE).

Unk13.Wiki: Needs testing. Seems to be about not needing poise to be full/armor poise to perform Toughness.

Unk14.Wiki: This determines whether the item is a paired weapon.\nEffects include enabling the L1 moveset when 2 handing and changing the animation played when 2 handing.\nThis animation can be changed or reverted in HKS.

IsAutoEquip.Wiki: Automatically equips the item when picked up, if slots are empty.

Unk21.Wiki: Determines the stat graph used for Magic damage (i.e. how effective a stat is).\nAlso affects INT portion of Spell buff if applicable.

Unk22.Wiki: Determines the stat graph used for Fire damage (i.e. how effective a stat is).

Unk23.Wiki: Determines the stat graph used for Lightning damage (i.e. how effective a stat is).\nAlso affects FTH portion of Spell buff if applicable.

Unk24.Wiki: Modifies damage done to WeakE-type enemies

Unk25.Wiki: Modifies damage done to WeakF-type enemies

darkGuardCutRate.Wiki: The Dark absorption to use when guarding.

atkBaseDark.Wiki: The base Dark damage.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

Unk26.Wiki: Determines the stat graph used for Dark damage (i.e. how effective a stat is).

AtkThrowEscapeA.Wiki: Determines the stat graph used for Poison buildup (i.e. how effective a stat is).

swordArt_ActId.Wiki: Set to 99 for Torch to make it have No Skill. 0 otherwise.

AtkThrowEscapeB.Wiki: Determines the stat graph used for Bleed buildup (i.e. how effective a stat is).

Unk31.Wiki: The Frost resistance to use when guarding.

swordArtId.Wiki: Determines the SwordArtsParam ID to use.

correctLuck.Wiki: The base scaling value used for Luck.\nNote that this is multiplied by reinforcement (via ReinforceParamWeapon).

Unk34.Wiki: Used to change the version of a weapon buff VFX to better fit the weapon's shape.

displayTypeId.Wiki: This is the weapon class displayed in the in-game menu. Reference ManuValueTableParam.

CalcCorrectVal0.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 160.\nScales with DEX and is affected by DEX requirement.

CalcCorrectVal1.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 161.\nScales with DEX and is affected by DEX requirement.

CalcCorrectVal2.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 161.\nScales with DEX and is affected by DEX requirement.

CalcCorrectVal3.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 161.\nScales with DEX and is affected by DEX requirement.

CalcCorrectVal4.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 161.\nScales with DEX and is affected by DEX requirement.

CalcCorrectVal5.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 162.\nScales with DEX and is affected by DEX requirement.

CalcCorrectVal6.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 162.\nScales with DEX and is affected by DEX requirement.

CalcCorrectVal7.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 162.\nScales with DEX and is affected by DEX requirement.

CalcCorrectVal8.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 162.\nScales with DEX and is affected by DEX requirement.

CalcCorrectVal9.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 162.\nScales with DEX and is affected by DEX requirement.

CalcCorrectVal10.Wiki: Max bonus possible. Scaling handled by CalcCorrectGraph 163.\nScales with STR and is affected by STR requirement.

weaponVfx4.Wiki: Dummy ID at which to position VFX ID 1

weaponVfx5.Wiki: Dummy ID at which to position VFX ID 2

weaponVfx6.Wiki: Dummy ID at which to position VFX ID 3

weaponVfx7.Wiki: Dummy ID at which to position VFX ID 4

StaminaConsumeRate.Wiki: Multiplier applied to the stamina costs defined in behavior.

Unk56.Wiki: Effectively second set of requirements. Can be checked in HKS and displayed.

Unk57.Wiki: Effectively second set of requirements. Can be checked in HKS and displayed.

Unk58.Wiki: Effectively second set of requirements. Can be checked in HKS and displayed.

Unk59.Wiki: Effectively second set of requirements. Can be checked in HKS and displayed.

Unk60.Wiki: Effectively second set of requirements. Can be checked in HKS.

attackElementCorrectId.Wiki: Determines how each damage type scales with each attribute.

shopPrice.Wiki: The soul cost of the weapon in a shop.

Unk62.Wiki: Determines what options are available when reinforcing weapons.\nHandled through event flags/ESD.
